translationBlock.key: Find a bug in this page? %sEdit this page yourself, then submit a pull request.%s (Note this page is automatically generated from the documentation in the source code.)

The recipeArray can contain the following keys: Shaped Recipe Data. Turns 9 stone into obsidian. Shapeless Recipe Data. Combines tall grass and dirt to make grass block. Furnace Recipe Data. Turn grass or mycelium into dirt through smelting. (multi-item type input) StoneCutting Recipe Data. Turns diamond hoe into diamond. (single item type input)
Adds a recipe to the server and returns whether it was added or not.

Demonstrates a shaped recipe with multiple ingredient choices. If just one of the ingredient choices is an item array (i.e. associative array instead of string), all other ingredient choices for that key are also treated as exact ingredients.

Demonstrates adding a shaped recipe with exact ingredients using item arrays. The item ingredient must match exactly, including unspecified meta. (except 'qty') In this example, the regen potion ingredient must NOT be extended or upgraded for it to match, because those are the default values.

Shaped Recipe Data. Turns 9 stone into obsidian. Shapeless Recipe Data. Combines tall grass and dirt to make grass block. Furnace Recipe Data. Turn grass or mycelium into dirt through smelting. (multi-item type input) StoneCutting Recipe Data. Turns diamond hoe into diamond. (single item type input)

The recipeArray can contain the following keys:'''type''' : (required) The type of recipe. Expected to be 'BLASTING', 'CAMPFIRE', 'FURNACE', 'SHAPED', 'SHAPELESS', 'SMOKING', or 'STONECUTTING'. '''key''' : (required) A unique string id for this recipe. '''result''' : (required) The result item array of the recipe. '''group''' : (optional) A group id for grouping recipes in the recipe book. '''shape''' : (shaped) The shape of the recipe. Represented as a 3 index normal array. '''ingredients''' : (shaped and shapeless recipes) Ingredients array of the recipe. See examples. '''input''' : (cooking and stonecutting) The input item type or array of types for this recipe. '''cookingtime''' : (cooking) The amount of time in ticks for the input item to cook. '''experience''' : (cooking) The amount of experience generated by this recipe.

Demonstrates a shapeless recipe with exact ingredients. This is only possible on Paper servers. On Spigot, only the item material will be considered. Each element in the ingredients array may be a single item/material or an array of item/material choices (like how different types of planks can create a stick).

The recipeArray can contain the following keys:%s'''type''' : (required) The type of recipe. Expected to be BLASTING, CAMPFIRE, FURNACE, SHAPED, SHAPELESS, SMOKING, or STONECUTTING.%s'''key''' : (required) A unique string id for this recipe.%s'''result''' : (required) The result item array of the recipe.%s'''group''' : (optional) A group id for grouping recipes in the recipe book.%s'''shape''' : (shaped recipes) The shape of the ingredients in the crafting grid. This is a normal array of strings where each element is a row in the grid, and each string has a character for each column in the grid.%s'''ingredients''' : (shaped and shapeless recipes) Ingredients array of the recipe. Shaped recipes are an associative array mapping each character in the shape to a single ingredient item or material or an array of possible ingredient items or material. Shapeless recipes are a normal array of ingredients, where each element can be a single item or material, or each element can be an array of possible items or materials. Ingredients that are item arrays with meta will require exact ingredient matches.'''input''' : (cooking and stonecutting recipes) The input item type or array of possible types for this recipe.%s'''cookingtime''' : (cooking) An integer amount of time in ticks for the input item to cook.%s'''experience''' : (cooking) An integer amount of experience generated by this recipe.%sExamples:%s Shaped Recipe Data. Turns 9 stone into obsidian. Shapeless Recipe Data. Combines tall grass and dirt to make grass block. Furnace Recipe Data. Turn grass or mycelium into dirt through smelting. (multi-item type input) StoneCutting Recipe Data. Turns diamond hoe into diamond. (single item type input)

The recipeArray can contain the following keys:%s'''type''' : (required) The type of recipe. Expected to be BLASTING, CAMPFIRE, FURNACE, SHAPED, SHAPELESS, SMOKING, or STONECUTTING.%s'''key''' : (required) A unique string id for this recipe.%s'''result''' : (required) The result item array of the recipe.%s'''group''' : (optional) A group id for grouping recipes in the recipe book.%s'''shape''' : (shaped recipes) The shape of the ingredients in the crafting grid. This is a normal array of strings where each element is a row in the grid, and each string has a character for each column in the grid.%s'''ingredients''' : (shaped and shapeless recipes) Ingredients array of the recipe. Shaped recipes are an associative array mapping each character in the shape to a single ingredient item or material or an array of possible ingredient items or material. Shapeless recipes are a normal array of ingredients, where each element can be a single item or material, or each element can be an array of possible items or materials. Ingredients that are item arrays with meta will require exact ingredient matches.%s'''input''' : (cooking and stonecutting recipes) The input item type or array of possible types for this recipe.%s'''cookingtime''' : (cooking) An integer amount of time in ticks for the input item to cook.%s'''experience''' : (cooking) An integer amount of experience generated by this recipe.%sExamples:%s Shaped Recipe Data. Turns 9 stone into obsidian. Shapeless Recipe Data. Combines tall grass and dirt to make grass block. Furnace Recipe Data. Turn grass or mycelium into dirt through smelting. (multi-item type input) StoneCutting Recipe Data. Turns diamond hoe into diamond. (single item type input)
